intro: Polyalthia yingjiangensis, commonly known as the Yingjiang tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Yunnan Province, where it thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem and a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
